intro: Lasiosiphon genistifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leaved lasiosiphon, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. Its leaves are narrow and opposite, often with a slightly hairy surface. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodland or grassland habitats.
